meanings.definition: A piece of material worn around the neck and tied in a knot.
meanings.sent1: He wore a colorful tie to the party.
meanings.sent2: The tie matched his shirt perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The tie looked like a rainbow around his neck.
meanings.sent4: His tie was a splash of color in the sea of suits.
meanings.sent5: The tie had a pattern of tiny elephants marching along.

meanings.definition: A result in a game or competition where both sides have the same score.
meanings.sent1: The soccer match ended in a tie.
meanings.sent2: The tie was unexpected but fair.
meanings.sent3: The tie left both teams feeling satisfied.
meanings.sent4: The tie was like a stalemate in chess.
meanings.sent5: The tie meant they would have a rematch next week.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a string or cord.
meanings.sent1: He needed to tie his shoelaces before running.
meanings.sent2: She asked him to tie the package with a bow.
meanings.sent3: He tried to tie a knot with spaghetti - silly idea!
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was tied with trust.
meanings.sent5: She managed to tie the rope securely around the tree.

meanings.sent1: The bridge will tie the two islands together.
meanings.sent2: His speech managed to tie all the ideas into one coherent message.
meanings.sent3: She wanted to tie their friendship with a secret handshake.
meanings.sent4: Their destinies were tied together like threads in a tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The necklace tied the outfit together perfectly.
